answers.answer: How did your doctor diagnose the degenerative disc problems?  Are x-rays and/or MRI confirming this diagnosis?  Which area is primarily involved (cervical/lumbar/both)?While some of the symptoms you describe could be related to the DDD, there are other avenues which might need further evaluation/diagnostic testing.Based on your age and your primary occupation, you have probably done repeat heavy lifting and other duties that could have resulted in more degenerative changes and possible disc protrusion/herniation that is causing your current symptoms.Discuss with your doctor whether an MRI is indicated and if he disagrees, ask him for his reasons ----     The cost of an MRI versus your lost income from being unable to perform your job is a vital component of this equation.  The value of keeping you employed and a productive member of the work force is important.If all other body functions (ie cardiac, endocrine (diabetes, thyroid) have been deemed fine with no pathology, the focus needs to be on your progressive DDD and any interval changes that have occurred.Physical therapy will help in conditioning your muscles and provide some instructions on managing your activity to avoid risk of injury,  It is beneficial to participate if possible.Has the doctor mentioned the possibility of epidural injections?  There are other more aggressive treatment options and they should be explored in a frank and open discussion with your doctor.  If you feel that your needs are not being met or the doctor is unresponsive to your concerns, it might be advisable to obtain a second opinion from an orthopedic spine specialist.Best wishes ----

question: My legs have gotten progressively worse over the last 3 years to where I'm unable to walk more than about 100 feet. My calves, thighs and ankles hurt to the touch. Now I'm losing sleep due to muscle cramps, numbness (severe) and pain. I've been diagnosed with degenarative disk problems but given no relief from same. I'm starting to experience depression and of course loss of work. My doctor has ordered physical therapy? I hurt so badly last night I thought of the ER. Any suggestions? I work in a hospital as a nursing assistant and I'm 60 years old.
title: Severe Leg Pain
